pr_title: [MO] - [refactor] -> fileutils reworked to try with resource

timeline.message:
[MO] - [refactor] -> fileutils reworked to try with resource

Signed-off-by: see-quick <xorsak02@stud.fit.vutbr.cz>

timeline.bodyText: This case of the zip entry being a directory is no longer handled.
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.author: see-quick

replies.bodyText:
There's this thing called Javadoc, you really should check it out 😉... It will create directories which don't exist. mkdir() (singular) will just create a single dir, failing if the parent doesn't exist. mkdirs() will create parent (and all the way up, as necessary).
The truth is that malformed zips are not unheard of (e.g. missing directory entries, or directory entries after file entries in that directory), so you probably should mkdirs(file.getParentFile()) even in the else block.
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the exlanation and sorry for stupid question...Anyway i come up with the following sollution on this problem based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27904329/warning-file-mkdir-is-ignored
replies.author: see-quick

timeline.bodyText: I guess we should fix the captialization NameSpace → Namespace
timeline.author: tombentley

timeline.bodyText: Wrapping into a RuntimeException is preferred, because it's much less easily overlooked.
timeline.author: tombentley

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you need the ;
timeline.author: tombentley
tombentley

replies.bodyText: I have changed that now i will use return value from file.mkdirs() so it is not longer needed.
replies.author: see-quick

timeline.author: tombentley
